AlertingConfig.description: AlertingConfig configures alerting and alertmanager related configs.

scheme.description: The URL scheme to use when talking to Alertmanagers.

path_prefix.description: Path prefix to add in front of the push endpoint path.

timeout.description: The timeout used when sending alerts.

alert_relabel_configs.description: Relabel alerts before sending to the specific alertmanager.

AlertmanagerConfig.description: AlertmanagerConfig configures how Alertmanagers can be discovered and communicated with.

BasicAuth.description: BasicAuth contains basic HTTP authentication credentials.

Config.description: Config is the top-level configuration for Prometheus's config files.

max_exemplars.description:
MaxExemplars sets the size, in # of exemplars stored, of the single circular buffer used to store exemplars in memory.
Use a value of 0 or less than 0 to disable the storage without having to restart Prometheus.

ExemplarsConfig.description: ExemplarsConfig configures runtime reloadable configuration options.

scrape_interval.description: How frequently to scrape targets by default.

scrape_timeout.description: The default timeout when scraping targets.

scrape_protocols.description:
The protocols to negotiate during a scrape. It tells clients what
protocol are accepted by Prometheus and with what weight (most wanted is first).
Supported values (case sensitive): PrometheusProto, OpenMetricsText0.0.1,
OpenMetricsText1.0.0, PrometheusText0.0.4.

evaluation_interval.description: How frequently to evaluate rules by default.

rule_query_offset.description: Offset the rule evaluation timestamp of this particular group by the specified duration into the past to ensure the underlying metrics have been received.

query_log_file.description: File to which PromQL queries are logged.

scrape_failure_log_file.description: File to which scrape failures are logged.

external_labels.description: The labels to add to any timeseries that this Prometheus instance scrapes.

body_size_limit.description:
An uncompressed response body larger than this many bytes will cause the
scrape to fail. 0 means no limit.

sample_limit.description:
More than this many samples post metric-relabeling will cause the scrape to
fail. 0 means no limit.

target_limit.description:
More than this many targets after the target relabeling will cause the
scrapes to fail. 0 means no limit.

label_limit.description:
More than this many labels post metric-relabeling will cause the scrape to
fail. 0 means no limit.

label_name_length_limit.description:
More than this label name length post metric-relabeling will cause the
scrape to fail. 0 means no limit.

label_value_length_limit.description:
More than this label value length post metric-relabeling will cause the
scrape to fail. 0 means no limit.

keep_dropped_targets.description:
Keep no more than this many dropped targets per job.
0 means no limit.

metric_name_validation_scheme.description: Allow UTF8 Metric and Label Names.

GlobalConfig.description: GlobalConfig configures values that are used across other configuration objects.

basic_auth.description: The HTTP basic authentication credentials for the targets.

authorization.description: The HTTP authorization credentials for the targets.

oauth2.description: The OAuth2 client credentials used to fetch a token for the targets.

bearer_token.description:
The bearer token for the targets. Deprecated in favour of
Authorization.Credentials.

bearer_token_file.description:
The bearer token file for the targets. Deprecated in favour of
Authorization.CredentialsFile.

tls_config.description: TLSConfig to use to connect to the targets.

follow_redirects.description:
FollowRedirects specifies whether the client should follow HTTP 3xx redirects.
The omitempty flag is not set, because it would be hidden from the
marshalled configuration when set to false.

enable_http2.description:
EnableHTTP2 specifies whether the client should configure HTTP2.
The omitempty flag is not set, because it would be hidden from the
marshalled configuration when set to false.

proxy_url.description: HTTP proxy server to use to connect to the targets.

no_proxy.description: NoProxy contains addresses that should not use a proxy.

proxy_from_environment.description:
ProxyFromEnvironment makes use of net/http ProxyFromEnvironment function
to determine proxies.

proxy_connect_header.description:
ProxyConnectHeader optionally specifies headers to send to
proxies during CONNECT requests. Assume that at least _some_ of
these headers are going to contain secrets and use Secret as the
value type instead of string.

Label.description: Label is a key/value pair of strings.

LabelNames.description: LabelNames is a sortable LabelName slice.

LabelSet.description: A LabelSet is a collection of LabelName and LabelValue pairs.

Labels.description: Labels is implemented by a SymbolTable and string holding name/value pairs encoded as indexes into the table in varint encoding.

send.description: Send controls whether we send metric metadata to remote storage.

send_interval.description: SendInterval controls how frequently we send metric metadata.

max_samples_per_send.description: Maximum number of samples per send.

MetadataConfig.description: MetadataConfig is the configuration for sending metadata to remote storage.

OTLPConfig.description: OTLPConfig is the configuration for writing to the OTLP endpoint.

proxy_url.description: HTTP proxy server to use to connect to the targets.

no_proxy.description: NoProxy contains addresses that should not use a proxy.

proxy_from_environment.description:
ProxyFromEnvironment makes use of net/http ProxyFromEnvironment function
to determine proxies.

proxy_connect_header.description:
ProxyConnectHeader optionally specifies headers to send to
proxies during CONNECT requests. Assume that at least _some_ of
these headers are going to contain secrets and use Secret as the
value type instead of string.

Oauth2.description: OAuth2 is the oauth2 client configuration.

capacity.description:
Number of samples to buffer per shard before we block. Defaults to
MaxSamplesPerSend.

max_shards.description: Max number of shards, i.e. amount of concurrency.

min_shards.description: Min number of shards, i.e. amount of concurrency.

max_samples_per_send.description: Maximum number of samples per send.

batch_send_deadline.description: Maximum time sample will wait in buffer.

sample_age_limit.description: Samples older than the limit will be dropped.

QueueConfig.description: QueueConfig is the configuration for the queue used to write to remote storage.

source_labels.description:
A list of labels from which values are taken and concatenated
with the configured separator in order.

separator.description: Separator is the string between concatenated values from the source labels.

regex.description: Regex against which the concatenation is matched.

modulus.description: Modulus to take of the hash of concatenated values from the source labels.

target_label.description:
TargetLabel is the label to which the resulting string is written in a replacement.
Regexp interpolation is allowed for the replace action.

replacement.description: Replacement is the regex replacement pattern to be used.

action.description: Action is the action to be performed for the relabeling.

RelabelConfig.description: Config is the configuration for relabeling of target label sets.

RelabelRegexp.description: Regexp encapsulates a regexp.Regexp and makes it YAML marshalable.

HTTPClientConfig.description:
We cannot do proper Go type embedding below as the parser will then parse
values arbitrarily into the overflow maps of further-down types.

required_matchers.description:
RequiredMatchers is an optional list of equality matchers which have to
be present in a selector to query the remote read endpoint.

filter_external_labels.description: Whether to use the external labels as selectors for the remote read endpoint.

RemoteReadConfig.description: RemoteReadConfig is the configuration for reading from remote storage.

protobuf_message.description:
ProtobufMessage specifies the protobuf message to use against the remote
receiver as specified in https://prometheus.io/docs/specs/remote_write_spec_2_0/

HTTPClientConfig.description:
We cannot do proper Go type embedding below as the parser will then parse
values arbitrarily into the overflow maps of further-down types.

RemoteWriteConfig.description: RemoteWriteConfig is the configuration for writing to remote storage.

gogc.description: The Go garbage collection target percentage.

RuntimeConfig.description: RuntimeConfig configures the values for the process behavior.

job_name.description: The job name to which the job label is set by default.

honor_labels.description: Indicator whether the scraped metrics should remain unmodified.

honor_timestamps.description: Indicator whether the scraped timestamps should be respected.

track_timestamps_staleness.description: Indicator whether to track the staleness of the scraped timestamps.

params.description: A set of query parameters with which the target is scraped.

scrape_interval.description: How frequently to scrape the targets of this scrape config.

scrape_timeout.description: The timeout for scraping targets of this config.

scrape_protocols.description:
The protocols to negotiate during a scrape. It tells clients what
protocol are accepted by Prometheus and with what preference (most wanted is first).
Supported values (case sensitive): PrometheusProto, OpenMetricsText0.0.1,
OpenMetricsText1.0.0, PrometheusText1.0.0, PrometheusText0.0.4.

fallback_scrape_protocol.description:
The fallback protocol to use if the Content-Type provided by the target
is not provided, blank, or not one of the expected values.
Supported values (case sensitive): PrometheusProto, OpenMetricsText0.0.1,
OpenMetricsText1.0.0, PrometheusText1.0.0, PrometheusText0.0.4.

always_scrape_classic_histograms.description: Whether to scrape a classic histogram, even if it is also exposed as a native histogram.

convert_classic_histograms_to_nhcb.description: Whether to convert all scraped classic histograms into a native histogram with custom buckets.

scrape_failure_log_file.description: File to which scrape failures are logged.

metrics_path.description: The HTTP resource path on which to fetch metrics from targets.

scheme.description: The URL scheme with which to fetch metrics from targets.

enable_compression.description: Indicator whether to request compressed response from the target.

body_size_limit.description:
An uncompressed response body larger than this many bytes will cause the
scrape to fail. 0 means no limit.

sample_limit.description:
More than this many samples post metric-relabeling will cause the scrape to
fail. 0 means no limit.

target_limit.description:
More than this many targets after the target relabeling will cause the
scrapes to fail. 0 means no limit.

label_limit.description:
More than this many labels post metric-relabeling will cause the scrape to
fail. 0 means no limit.

label_name_length_limit.description:
More than this label name length post metric-relabeling will cause the
scrape to fail. 0 means no limit.

label_value_length_limit.description:
More than this label value length post metric-relabeling will cause the
scrape to fail. 0 means no limit.

native_histogram_bucket_limit.description:
If there are more than this many buckets in a native histogram,
buckets will be merged to stay within the limit.

native_histogram_min_bucket_factor.description:
If the growth factor of one bucket to the next is smaller than this,
buckets will be merged to increase the factor sufficiently.

keep_dropped_targets.description:
Keep no more than this many dropped targets per job.
0 means no limit.

metric_name_validation_scheme.description: Allow UTF8 Metric and Label Names.

ScrapeConfig.description: ScrapeConfig configures a scraping unit for Prometheus.

StorageConfig.description: StorageConfig configures runtime reloadable configuration options.

OutOfOrderTimeWindow.description:
OutOfOrderTimeWindow sets how long back in time an out-of-order sample can be inserted
into the TSDB. This flag is typically set while unmarshaling the configuration file and translating
OutOfOrderTimeWindowFlag's duration. The unit of this flag is expected to be the same as any
other timestamp in the TSDB.

out_of_order_time_window.description:
OutOfOrderTimeWindowFlag holds the parsed duration from the config file.
During unmarshall, this is converted into milliseconds and stored in OutOfOrderTimeWindow.
This should not be used directly and must be converted into OutOfOrderTimeWindow.

TSDBConfig.description: TSDBConfig configures runtime reloadable configuration options.

ca.description: Text of the CA cert to use for the targets.

cert.description: Text of the client cert file for the targets.

key.description: Text of the client key file for the targets.

ca_file.description: The CA cert to use for the targets.

cert_file.description: The client cert file for the targets.

key_file.description: The client key file for the targets.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

Tlsconfig.description: TLSConfig configures the options for TLS connections.

Url.description: URL is a custom URL type that allows validation at configuration load time.
